meanings.definition: A stain applied to a biological specimen after the primary stain to give contrast to the primary stain.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a counterstain to make the cells easier to see.
meanings.sent2: After the first stain, the lab technician carefully added the counterstain.
meanings.sent3: The counterstain decided to show up fashionably late to the cell party.
meanings.sent4: Like a painter adding shadows, the counterstain brought depth to the slide.
meanings.sent5: The counterstain was like a spotlight highlighting the important details.

meanings.definition: To apply a stain to a biological specimen after the primary stain.
meanings.sent1: She will counterstain the slide to enhance the visibility of the cells.
meanings.sent2: Remember to counterstain the sample for accurate results.
meanings.sent3: The scientist decided to counterstain while singing a song about science.
meanings.sent4: His words counterstained the truth, making it stand out vividly.
meanings.sent5: The brush delicately counterstained the slide, revealing hidden details.
